metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18585 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
chmd_read_headers in mspack/chmd.c in libmspack before 0.8alpha accepts a filename that has '\0' as its first or second character (such as the "/\0" name).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-base - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-daemon - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-milter - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
libclamav7 - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> We released clamav 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1X.04.2 for precise/esm and trusty, but subsequently were notified the bundled libmspack is not actually vulnerable in this case, because ClamAV assigns a filename with a generated hash.

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2').
libmspack package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
